response_parsed.title: FastAPI Stream Processing in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: Learn how to leverage FastAPI's powerful features for implementing stream processing within Python 3.12+ applications.
key_points: Utilize FastAPI's built-in support for streaming data in requests and responses
Handle large files or streams efficiently without loading the entire content into memory
Integrate with popular asynchronous libraries like aiofiles, asyncio, and uvloop for stream processing performance boost
Create custom stream processing middleware to modify incoming and outgoing requests
version_notes: These examples are written specifically for Python 3.12+
Ensure you have installed the latest version of FastAPI (FastAPI v0.76.0 or later) to run these examples
Asynchronous libraries such as aiofiles, asyncio, and uvloop should also be up-to-date
caveats: Stream processing may involve additional complexities when handling multiple simultaneous connections
It's crucial to ensure proper resource management when dealing with large files or streams to prevent memory overload
Always test your application thoroughly to ensure optimal performance and stability
